comments.text:
Created attachment 554363
index.html

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

I created a fixed menu on the left site of the browser and 2 icons. the menu ist top:0 and left:0, so it is on the left site. Now when I go over on of that two icons, a panel is animated (with jquery) gone beside of the menu.
This panel has the background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.9) and the position is fixed, too.


Actual results:

after the panel is walking beside the menu, the menu has a display error. There's a white stripe on the top and left of the menu.
I have tried to solve this problem with top: -1px for the menu or #121212 for the background of the panel and that works. But not with rgba.

The Problem is only with the Browser Mozilla Firefox for Windows 7 (maybe only 64bit, I haven't got a 32bit system)


Expected results:

There shouldn't be a white stripe on the menu..
